summary: Zazelenimo is an open-source web platform designed to modernize participatory budgeting with a focus on urban greening initiatives. It leverages Ethereum and Quadratic Funding to empower communities, facilitate democratic funding, and enhance civic engagement. The project aims to integrate with municipal systems, starting with a pilot in the City of Split, and plans to use grant funds for technical development, legal compliance, and marketing efforts.
review: The Zazelenimo project presents a compelling case for enhancing civic engagement through open-source technology. It aligns well with the round's focus on accelerating open-source dApps and apps that offer novel utilities. The project's use of Ethereum and Quadratic Funding demonstrates innovation in application use cases, contributing to the Web3 ecosystem's growth. However, the application could benefit from more detailed information on the project's scalability and long-term impact beyond the initial pilot in Split. Additionally, while the project emphasizes community empowerment, it should also address how it plans to ensure equitable access and participation across different demographics.

strengths.title: Open-Source Foundation
strengths.description: Zazelenimo is built entirely on open-source technology, promoting transparency and collaboration.

strengths.title: Innovative Use of Quadratic Funding
strengths.description: The project utilizes Quadratic Funding to ensure democratic resource allocation, prioritizing community preferences over wealth concentration.

strengths.title: Municipal Integration
strengths.description: The project plans to integrate with the City of Split's smart city ecosystem, showcasing a practical application of Web3 technologies in public services.

weaknesses.title: Scalability Concerns
weaknesses.description: The application lacks detailed information on how the project will scale beyond the initial pilot in Split.

weaknesses.title: Equitable Access and Participation
weaknesses.description: While the project emphasizes community empowerment, it does not sufficiently address how it will ensure equitable access and participation across different demographics.

changes.title: Expand on Scalability Plans
changes.description: Provide more detailed information on how the project plans to scale beyond the initial pilot in Split to maximize its impact.

changes.title: Address Equitable Access
changes.description: Include strategies to ensure equitable access and participation across different demographics to enhance community empowerment.
